channel.title: Daily Feed (Updated 9 AM BD)
channel.description: Daily Feed (Updated 9 AM BD) generated by script

item.title: The Trump Trade Tracker
item.description: The latest global picture on Trump’s tariff regime—including who has managed to cut a deal.

item.title: A Bridge Divided
item.description: Do expanding internal border controls within the Schengen zone compromise the European project?

item.title: For Syrian Refugees, U.S. Aid Cuts Have Been Devastating
item.description: Many face a tough choice—remain in squalid camps or return to a troubled homeland.

item.title: Trump, Takaichi Seek New Trade, Security Opportunities to Counter China
item.description: After signing several trade deals at the ASEAN summit, the U.S. president is turning his attention to Washington’s East Asian partners.

item.title: El Boletín newsletter: The fallout from Javier Milei’s big win
item.description: Kinley Salmon, our Latin America correspondent, looks at Argentina’s midterm elections

item.title: Why big oil is missing out on the AI energy bonanza
item.description: A looming supply glut is weighing on giants from Exxon to Shell

item.title: How Trump Could Win Over the Developing World
item.description: At a time when developing countries are under fiscal pressure and struggling to invest in future growth, the United States could come to the rescue – and without putting one cent of its own money on the line. Rarely has there been a better moment for a new issuance of the International Monetary Fund's global reserve asset.

item.title: Xi Jinping’s latest purge: paranoid or purposeful?
item.description: What the biggest military crackdown in decades says about his strength

item.title: Who Is Messing With Airplane GPS Worldwide?
item.description: A wave of global interference threatens air safety.

item.title: Wall Street Risks Shorting Freedom in Hong Kong
item.description: By attending a big investment summit in Hong Kong, Western financiers are showing what really drives them. The only conclusion to draw is that they are willing to chase short-term profits even if it means funding a repressive regime that has made no secret of its animosity toward the West.

item.title: The end of the rip-off economy
item.description: From medicine to finance, artificial intelligence is radically improving market efficiency

item.title: The meaning of America’s vast military build-up off Venezuela
item.description: The world’s largest aircraft carrier is making for the Venezuelan coast. Its military aims are unclear

item.title: The Case for a Multilateral Trade Organization Without America
item.description: US President Donald Trump’s divide-and-rule tactics have shattered the postwar multilateral order. To preserve open, rules-based commerce, America’s major trading partners must form a new coalition capable of upholding the principles that the World Trade Organization can no longer guarantee.

item.title: How Trump’s White House Renovation Differs from Truman’s
item.description: Both projects attracted public scrutiny and criticism, yet the contrast in approach is telling.

item.title: China Needs a Consumption Target
item.description: As Chinese leaders prepare the 15th Five-Year Plan, early signs indicate that it will focus on continuing China’s extraordinary technological ascendancy. But they should be more concerned with boosting consumer demand, which means setting a clear target of raising household consumption to 50% of GDP by 2035.

item.title: How to Implement the Cambodia-Thailand Peace Agreement
item.description: Other ceasefire monitoring cases provide lessons for turning an agreement into lasting peace.

item.title: Saudi Investors Are Eyeing Afghanistan’s Resources
item.description: Investor interest could open doors for deeper engagement between Riyadh and the Taliban, now in power in Kabul.

item.title: How China’s Green Surplus Defines Indonesia’s Energy Future
item.description: China’s rise as a clean energy giant is reshaping the global economy faster than any previous industrial shift. Indonesia is a case in point.

item.title: Pakistan Offers US a Port Near Gwadar
item.description: Will a US-developed port at Pasni, just 100 kilometers from the China-developed Gwadar Port, be acceptable to Beijing?

item.title: The Chinese Military’s New Third in Command
item.description: After a string of purges on the Central Military Commission, how long will new Vice Chair Zhang Shengmin last?

item.title: Does ASEAN Actually Matter?
item.description: This year's summit reflects the prominent place that ASEAN occupies in Asia’s diplomatic calendar. But some say the organization has devolved into an ineffective talk-shop.

item.title: The July Charter: A New Beginning for Bangladesh’s Democratic Future
item.description: It is a bold attempt to reset Bangladesh’s democratic trajectory after years of political unrest, authoritarian drift, and institutional erosion.

item.title: Decoding Hindutva’s US Operations
item.description: The RSS does not maintain any formal link with its foreign affiliates, but there are a plethora of Hindutva organizations operating in the US.

item.title: Can Trump Achieve Eternal Peace in Gaza?
item.description: The United States is the only power that can succeed as a peacemaker in the Middle East; but that doesn’t mean the task will be easy. The question now is whether US President Donald Trump has the patience and stamina that brokering a lasting political resolution between Israelis and Palestinians requires.

item.title: Javier Milei has won a fresh mandate to remake Argentina
item.description: A thumping win for his party in the midterms means his radical economic project gains new strength

item.title: ‘History Is Made’: Timor-Leste Becomes ASEAN’s 11th Member
item.description: The country's admission caps off a 14-year journey toward accession, but also presents new challenges for the Southeast Asian bloc.

item.title: Why Rare Earths Are About to Cost a Lot More
item.description: Contrary to Trump’s claim, diversifying the supply chain won’t drive down prices.

item.title: How to Make AI More Useful
item.description: The obsession with powerful large language models overlooks the developing world.

item.title: Losing the Swing States
item.description: Washington is driving the BRICS to become an anti-American bloc.
